div.p: Well, DeSales was nice and convenient as far as location.
I was working at L. L. Bean at the time and it was very close to work.
The flexible schedule-- the ability to start and stop when I needed to, and really,
the accelerated format of having 8-week courses and being able to get all my classes
in in a timely manner to get everything done was really a key
and important reason for coming here.
I did check various schools in the area and I felt that DeSales fit my lifestyle.
I was able to choose the courses I wanted, when I wanted, and it wasn't a continuous team thing
that the other schools seemed to be.
It was more a school that graded you on you.
First of all, I'm Catholic and I like the idea of going to a Catholic university.
Plus the flexibility in the scheduling, the class sizes were excellent.
It was just convenient.
I live in the Lehigh Valley.
It has an excellent reputation.
I believe it's been over 30 years that the program's been in progress.
That's really what drove me to make my decision to attend the program.
What appealed to me most in what DeSales had to offer in ACCESS was the fast, 8-week.
A lot of work but you got the credits in 8 weeks.
So you are able to do it in a much shorter time.
And being and adult in a busy world, it afforded me an instant gratification on those.
I was no sooner able to get head deep into the course and it would be ending,
and I'd be moving on to something else.
I did like the rapid pace.
That appealed to me.
